newsitem.title: YUGOSLAVIA: Serbian police withdraw, end all-night impasse.
newsitem.headline: Serbian police withdraw, end all-night impasse.

text.p: Serbian riot police withdrew from central Belgrade on Saturday morning and students went ahead with a protest march after an all-night vigil, witnesses said.
The cordon of 300 riot police, plus more in buses, started to leave Belgrade's Terazije Square at 6.30 a.m. (0530 GMT), ending a stand-off with the students.

The police had prevented a crowd, which at one point numbered up to 4,000 students, from marching through the city as they have for the past several nights to support demands that Socialist President Slobodan Milosevic reinstate opposition victories in municipal elections annulled last November.

It was the first time that there has been an all-night stand-off between police and students, but the mood throughout the night was mostly friendly. At one point, priests sprinkled the police cordon with holy water.

"The government wants to send us home but they must realise that after 60 days (of protests) our home is on the streets until they give us what we want," Tedomir Jovanovic, one of the student leaders, said.
